summary: Created standalone Python server 'Semantix Brain' with ChromaDB, FastAPI, and ultra-modular architecture - solving cross-project memory sync issues

problem_solved.original_issue: MCP and UI reading from different .sementix paths across projects
problem_solved.root_cause: File-based memory system with hardcoded paths, cross-project confusion
problem_solved.blocker: New memories (Oct 2) not appearing in MCP search, only in UI dashboard
problem_solved.impact: Claude couldn't remember work across chat sessions

solution_approach.strategy: Build centralized Python server with ChromaDB for all memory operations
solution_approach.architecture: Ultra-modular, event-driven ready, dependency injection throughout
solution_approach.isolation: Standalone project in semantix-brain folder for future extraction
solution_approach.migration: Script to import file-based memories to ChromaDB

project_structure.name: semantix-brain
project_structure.philosophy: Sementix best practices - single responsibility, DI, scalable

technology_stack.framework: FastAPI - modern async Python web framework
technology_stack.database: ChromaDB 1.1.0 - vector database for semantic search

folder_structure.api: FastAPI routes (thin controllers) - health, search, memory endpoints
folder_structure.events: EventBus placeholder for future event-driven features

memory_model.fields: task, agent, date, component, summary, temporal_context, tags, content
memory_model.temporal_context: year, month, week_number, quarter, time_period for date filtering
memory_model.embedding_text: Method to extract searchable text from memory

chromadb_repository.pattern: Repository pattern for clean data access abstraction
chromadb_repository.metadata: Flat dict for ChromaDB filtering (year, quarter, time_period, etc)
chromadb_repository.document: Full memory JSON stored as document for retrieval

embedding_service.async: AsyncIO with httpx for non-blocking requests

memory_service.date_filtering: DateFilter class with ChromaDB where clause generation

api_endpoints.health: GET /health - service status and memory count
api_endpoints.create_memory: POST /memories - add new memory with embedding

migration_script.purpose: Import file-based memories from .sementix/memories/delta to ChromaDB
features: Rate limiting to avoid API throttling

ultra_modular_architecture.separation_of_concerns: Clear boundaries: API → Service → Repository → Infrastructure

right_sized_complexity.pragmatic: EventBus is placeholder, not fully implemented

development_timeline.phase_1: Architecture design and project structure planning
development_timeline.phase_6: API layer (FastAPI endpoints with dependency injection)

challenge_1.issue: Hatchling build error - couldn't find package
challenge_1.error: Unable to determine which files to ship inside the wheel
challenge_1.lesson: Hatchling needs explicit package location for src layout

challenge_2.issue: ChromaDB not installed after pip install -e .
challenge_2.solution: Ran pip install chromadb separately to complete installation
challenge_2.lesson: Large packages like ChromaDB may need extended timeout or separate install

challenge_3.issue: Module import errors on first run
challenge_3.resolution: Verified installation, all imports working correctly

server_output: ChromaDB: Connected to collection 'sementix_memories' with 0 memories
Startup complete - ready to serve requests

why_python: FastAPI provides modern async API framework
why_fastapi: Async support out of the box
why_standalone_project: Easier to extract and deploy separately later
Can be moved to separate repository easily

Test search endpoints with real data

short_term: Batch import API for bulk memory additions

benefits: Single source of truth for all memories
Server can run independently of VS Code

memorable_moments.anticipation: Ready to migrate memories and solve the sync issue once and for all
